revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 15:23:00.000000000', 'message': "Raise min version of ddt

Raise min version of ddt to 1.4.4, which fixes a regression in the
'idata' decorator in 1.4.3 that breaks our unit tests.

This change does not need to be backported as ddt is capped at
1.4.2 in xena.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/811555/
Change-Id: Ide8665722bdf7f55f92d2e2c95724cf88e8db657
"}]
commit_message:
Raise min version of ddt

Raise min version of ddt to 1.4.4, which fixes a regression in the
'idata' decorator in 1.4.3 that breaks our unit tests.

This change does not need to be backported as ddt is capped at
1.4.2 in xena.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/811555/
Change-Id: Ide8665722bdf7f55f92d2e2c95724cf88e8db657

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-18 19:44:51.000000000', 'message': "mypy: update retry decorator in utils.py

Current type hint for the retry decorator doesn't take into account
how it was generalized by change I6824ba4fbcb6 or that the retry_param
can take tuples.

Change-Id: Iea9e1af42ee3ff931cda62ef83b6c165bc62f9ae
"}]
commit_message:
mypy: update retry decorator in utils.py

Current type hint for the retry decorator doesn't take into account
how it was generalized by change I6824ba4fbcb6 or that the retry_param
can take tuples.

Change-Id: Iea9e1af42ee3ff931cda62ef83b6c165bc62f9ae

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent spec file name

A spec files should be named following name of the puppet class it
tests. This change fixes the wrong spec file name which tests
the octavia::provider::ovn class. Its current name assumes the spec
file tests the octavia::ovn::provider class.

Change-Id: I0e5728208c8ea62a73b10b555ca409aabf0142af
(cherry picked from commit a9a19950abac63eaf2ffcc169257ca245fd2c560)

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Don't use dhcp in L3 agent tests

It's not really needed and it is causing failures due to bug [1].
We can revert that patch and use dhcp again when [1] will be fixed
on the privsep's side.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/794994

Closes-Bug: #1946186
Change-Id: I7f888fa0737a1e52cee758afee6b790ca6a80a32

subject: Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 11292, 'name': 'Arne Wiebalck', 'email': 'Arne.Wiebalck@cern.ch', 'username': 'wiebalck'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23851, 'name': 'Riccardo Pittau', 'email': 'elfosardo@gmail.com', 'username': 'elfosardo'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-10-13 09:26:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2021-10-13 09:26:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-10-13 09:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-10-15 10:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 09:26:04.000000000', 'message': 'Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5
(cherry picked from commit 9d707e9f4bab40109b7e29df2136e86d65325ea3)
'}]
commit_message:
Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5
(cherry picked from commit 9d707e9f4bab40109b7e29df2136e86d65325ea3)

messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-10-14 12:58:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2021-10-15 13:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 12:58:07.000000000', 'message': "Restore reproducibility in docs

The documentation is writting the date in its copyright. This is
considered bad practice, because this kills reproducibility. If
you don't know about reproducible build, please read on:

https: //reproducible-builds.org/
Change-Id: I6199d139e3c8334b7795bdb4875553c613adcec7
"}]
commit_message:
Restore reproducibility in docs

The documentation is writting the date in its copyright. This is
considered bad practice, because this kills reproducibility. If
you don't know about reproducible build, please read on:

https: //reproducible-builds.org/
Change-Id: I6199d139e3c8334b7795bdb4875553c613adcec7

commit_message:
partial-backport: oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Partial-Backport: Some of the changes were not backported before W

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
(cherry picked from commit 63f881be6e759e91b008fa25894bd07e1403dbf3)
(cherry picked from commit d91ed58a6015acdf509bd7d8bbc0287f5a314ca8)
(cherry picked from commit 75b0fc7dced7e0c5811be5b4d9fd60e0835f58a5)
(cherry picked from commit 14d6bf1c35dad417b13bb0ec4bec713e133909bc)

commit_message:
SRBAC - Prepare for additional services

In order to effectively handle cross-service integrations, we need to
evaluate two separate items which are not standardized in devstack.

Names, and common service references. Unfortunately, only a couple
services presently have support in devstack for these settings, and
cases where it was previously supported has been removed for unknown
reasons, but this seems to be the overall plan.

Sets the stage, so we can be early to the cross-service testing party
of secure rbac.

Change-Id: I8794374c02a24185b6e24a675ad9cb7b3dfd69df

commit_message:
Allow to pass arbitrary parameters to TCIB image config

This new parameter takes key=value format, and can be passed multiple
times.

Those key/values can then be used within the image description files in
order to make them support different releases, or just use the value in
case we have a specific version (python-version for instance).

This will be useful in order to support container builds on both CS8 and
CS9 releases without too many duplications or headaches.

Note that a "tcib_" prefix is enforced for the keys.

Closes-Bug: #1942510
Change-Id: I7fe4d59f1fb76ba59d065b56c5900f4d3cfcda2e
(cherry picked from commit fb6daacedd733fbaa801507a7acf14c699faf0c5)
(cherry picked from commit 351bc64f4cbd823bcfc33676b11af4d2eac831c3)

subject: Fix haproxy Let's Encrypt SSL path
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-30 14:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-09-30 14:54:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-04 15:06:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think the certbot hooks need updating to reflect this destination path.

I'm also wondering if these certs need copying to multiple destinations if there are extra front ends defined via 'extra_lb_tls_vip_addresses'. Otherwise I'm guessing these will fall back to self-signed certs."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-10-05 07:49:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-05 14:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-05 14:53:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've dealt with the required changes to the hooks in this patch.

In doing this I've also added copies of the Let's Encrypt certs for any 'extra_lb_tls_vip_addresses'. This is intended to ensure the role behaves as it did before the bug (where all TLS used haproxy.pem), but I realise that there may be some situations where people want some of their extra addresses to use the Let's Encrypt cert, and some to use a self signed cert. This would perhaps be the subject of a future patch if required."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-10-05 15:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-12 13:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-10-15 09:44:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Fix haproxy Let's Encrypt SSL path

With releasing PKI role we broke Let's Encrypt option because of
changing directories where certs should be located
and not reflecting these changes for let's encrypt. At the same time
we should not generate self-signed cert when let's encrypt path is used.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible/+/811742
Closes-Bug: #1938961
Change-Id: I1a6701b171782528373bc1d0a39e70e6d1ef20ab

commit_message:
Improve patch download

* Add sSL flags to curl
* Remove verification of return code as we use set -euo pipefail which
  makes this code as dead
* Increase number of retries to 10

Change-Id: I7791ec0676324fb0eb512dcab7f0d79076bcba0e

commit_message:
Align haproxy logging config with charm-helpers

The previous config didn't actually log anything, and it has been fixed
for classic OpenStack API charms through charm-helpers. We need to
update layer-openstack as well to reflect those changes to reactive
OpenStack API charms.

Closes-Bug: #1697002
Related-Bug: #1940037
Change-Id: I523369673471f63346428f7f739a2429aa5084b3

commit_message:
21.10 - Stable cut of charms for testing period

* use stable/21.10 libraries
* use zaza/zaza-openstack-tests at stable/21.10
* build.lock files for reactive charms
* bundles refer to ~openstack-charms candidate channel

Change-Id: Ibc64fab6d4c057bef2b06ccdcb13ae11f4d8f98d

This commit adds jobs to run aganist stable/xena,
old jobs are moved to non-voting and removed from gate.

'}, {'created': '2021-09-08 10:45:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update tcib for CentOS Stream 9

It moves the EL8 and EL9 packages into two conditional
and also introduces python_version for both EL versions.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/807098
adds the support for passing extra parameters and based on those
parameter above distro and python version conditionals
will be evaluated.

Since collectd packages and ceph packages are not available
currently so are restricting to EL8.

In EL9, mariadb>10.5 will be used and it expects a new kolla
file which got added via [1].
[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/807577

Signed-off-by: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I23c64637e161c8054332c4e4761cd82802f3ae1f

'}, {'created': '2021-10-13 13:59:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update tcib for CentOS Stream 9

It moves the EL8 and EL9 packages into two conditional
and also introduces python_version for both EL versions.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/807098
adds the support for passing extra parameters and based on those
parameter above distro and python version conditionals
will be evaluated.

Since collectd packages and qdrouterd packages are not available
currently so are restricting to EL8.

Note: /usr/share/zoneinfo comes from tzdata and this directory
does not exists on base image. On reinstalling in a running
container, the directory exists but on a image it does not
exists. So In order to fix it, we are removing the tzdata
rpm and reinstalling it as a workaround.

Related-Bug: #1946461

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/800577

Signed-off-by: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I23c64637e161c8054332c4e4761cd82802f3ae1f
'}]
commit_message:
Update tcib for CentOS Stream 9

It moves the EL8 and EL9 packages into two conditional
and also introduces python_version for both EL versions.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/807098
adds the support for passing extra parameters and based on those
parameter above distro and python version conditionals
will be evaluated.

Since collectd packages and qdrouterd packages are not available
currently so are restricting to EL8.

Note: /usr/share/zoneinfo comes from tzdata and this directory
does not exists on base image. On reinstalling in a running
container, the directory exists but on a image it does not
exists. So In order to fix it, we are removing the tzdata
rpm and reinstalling it as a workaround.

Related-Bug: #1946461

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/800577

Signed-off-by: Ronelle Landy <rlandy@redhat.com>
Co-authored-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I23c64637e161c8054332c4e4761cd82802f3ae1f

commit_message:
partial-backport: oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Partial-Backport: Some of the changes were not backported before W

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
(cherry picked from commit 63f881be6e759e91b008fa25894bd07e1403dbf3)
(cherry picked from commit d91ed58a6015acdf509bd7d8bbc0287f5a314ca8)
(cherry picked from commit 75b0fc7dced7e0c5811be5b4d9fd60e0835f58a5)

[{'created': '2021-10-15 00:46:50.000000000', 'message': 'oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b
(cherry picked from commit 9c62de3d4c5f0c78445b450da917a6183e81f93b)
(cherry picked from commit 6d8ea31cbcda2cc915350eb3152c6ea9466a925a)
(cherry picked from commit ea51007651ba0e13c44f97fcf535a9c84c628b34)

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: container plugin is replaced with collections

Adding collections to meta will prevent failure as well as keeping the
code clean and concise.

also rewriting mock code because it doesn't work with collections.

Change-Id: I28070098ccd432b4f17ab145c2afc296e5d2bb69

commit_message:
Switch to mariadb:10.5 module

In EL9, we are consuming mariadb:10.5, It adds the same for
EL8 also.

It also copies the required security_reset[1] file
needed for mariadb:10.5

[1]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/807577

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I26174f6a450885fd65f8b1af5622d7d68c0aaf40
(cherry picked from commit 03abc41cacf6cafdcb12e22bf56c9a29f4b02614)

commit_message:
Drop UndercloudMinion environments

This is no longer valid with the switch to ephemeral heat for
deployments.

We dropped the tripleoclient code for minion in [1]. With this patch
dropping UndercloudMinion environments.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/811995

Change-Id: I097b9b69ba6ed132b7c9fb0bc0e42f06808c6ab2

commit_message:
Deprecate `OvsDpdkDriverType` parameter

``OvsDpdkDriverType`` is now deprecated. Note that is had no effect since we
upgraded to OVS 2.6, where we stopped supporting the configuration of DPDK driver
in puppet-vswitch. Since then, we couldn't change the driver; so we can safely
deprecate this parameter and remove it in a future release.

Change-Id: Ie11c49bc1435aba6a3a1fc62baca956b3920f608

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 12:22:15.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I39b443c0327e51fed15e7f8085f78add700b9596
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I39b443c0327e51fed15e7f8085f78add700b9596

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 16:26:56.000000000', 'message': "Update conditional to pass --tcib-extra

Commit[1] broke downstream container build jobs, job is failing with
following error:-
~~~
openstack tripleo container image build: error: unrecognized arguments:
--tcib-extra tcib_release=8 --tcib-extra tcib_python_version=3.6
~~~

It is not intended to pass --tcib-extra in downstream jobs, The job is
failing because in downstream, branch var is not sync with
upstream release names.

Let's switch to using release var instead to fix the issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/800577

Change-Id: I02b8cafd264b0b82eaf640413d3900f3297fcab6
"}]
commit_message:
Update conditional to pass --tcib-extra

Commit[1] broke downstream container build jobs, job is failing with
following error:-
~~~
openstack tripleo container image build: error: unrecognized arguments:
--tcib-extra tcib_release=8 --tcib-extra tcib_python_version=3.6
~~~

It is not intended to pass --tcib-extra in downstream jobs, The job is
failing because in downstream, branch var is not sync with
upstream release names.

Let's switch to using release var instead to fix the issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/800577

Change-Id: I02b8cafd264b0b82eaf640413d3900f3297fcab6

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing from stable branches

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to test
lower constraints [1]. As decided in horizon weekly meeting in
the past[2], stable branches will drop the lower-constraints job from CI.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2021-03-24.log.html#t2021-03-24T15:12:58

Change-Id: I3f4367817cdf04eacacba8b2ba2bbc06b09d3132
(cherry picked from commit 38ccf26b174c071f2ada5e65aa210634668786a3)

commit_message:
Fix node scaling for Ephemeral Heat

With Ephemeral Heat, we can no longer call
the Heat API while removing nodes, nor is it
necessary. This change removes all calls to
Heat and instead just executes the required
playbooks to perform the scale down actions.

Change-Id: Iba56d41d132275bd55e77290a6fca87b917de9e9

integrate the json_rpc options.

commit_message:
json_rpc: list_opts() should return tuple

list_opts() should return a tuple otherwise
oslo-config-(genera|valida)tors are unable to parse its output.

Story: 2009126
Task: 43039

Change-Id: Ib4b9c270709f5994bc2c031c339822d7d6b9356d
(cherry picked from commit f6ddd09d50d3181a7cc2f9f4e201c26522ee8143)

The similarity in the variable names for get and get_all slipped through

  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/806631

As a result, oslo.policy thought the policy name was changing, but it's

commit_message:
Fix typo in message policy deprecations

The similarity in the variable names for get and get_all slipped through
when we implemented project personas support for messages:

  https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/806631

As a result, oslo.policy thought the policy name was changing, but it's
not. This commit updates the policy deprecations to use the right
deprecation variables.

Change-Id: I2a83ab07ccec80b910c614a5f5743d642491e592

commit_message:
Libvirt: quote config parameters in resource types

This change implements the quote parameter in libvirtd_config and
virtlogd_config, so that we can quote the value by that simple
parameter instead of implementing a logic in each manifests.

Also, with this change libvirtd_config and virtlogd_config supports
$::os_service_default, so that we can define absence of parameters more
easily.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/801477
Change-Id: I3030ca34088019be932a9cc33344f7fb473a9aea
(cherry picked from commit 26dbd52717f46a1be8586dd61a6f265f8fe56f11)

commit_message:
Add API extension "security-groups-shared-filtering"

Add API extension "security-groups-shared-filtering". This extension
adds the "shared" field to security groups and allows users to filter
security groups based on the "shared" field.

Related-Bug: #1942615
Change-Id: Idba0af5a6ee1a2a8c02db51be197988d23412f0f

subject: Ease KeepAliveTimeout in line with keystoneauth1.session.Session
messages: [{'account_id': 8108, 'date': '2021-10-14 00:51:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2021-10-14 22:54:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 00:51:04.000000000', 'message': "Ease KeepAliveTimeout in line with keystoneauth1.session.Session

Apache2's default value for KeepAliveTimeout is 5 seconds, which is okay
for general web-page serving use cases. However, sessions and connection
pools created by keystoneauth1.session.Session can be terminated
unnecessarily during multiple API calls in a session due to the short
KeepAliveTimeout.

Let's ease KeepAliveTimeout to 75 seconds, which is fairly standard for
API services behind a reverse proxy since it's the default value of
nginx.

Closes-Bug: #1947010
Change-Id: I752a836676d895ef783362810ed6764980e8574b
"}]
commit_message:
Ease KeepAliveTimeout in line with keystoneauth1.session.Session

Apache2's default value for KeepAliveTimeout is 5 seconds, which is okay
for general web-page serving use cases. However, sessions and connection
pools created by keystoneauth1.session.Session can be terminated
unnecessarily during multiple API calls in a session due to the short
KeepAliveTimeout.

Let's ease KeepAliveTimeout to 75 seconds, which is fairly standard for
API services behind a reverse proxy since it's the default value of
nginx.

Closes-Bug: #1947010
Change-Id: I752a836676d895ef783362810ed6764980e8574b

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Allow for OCI manifests""

Add support for OCI manifests and includes a fix to handle the
schemaVersion 1 metadata which is used by the prometheus
containers upstream.

This reverts commit b2f76f8514baefb57e10c9a5562457b651ec29af.

Change-Id: I352cd33578eeb447d3a36cbca7767b1bfd5de7aa
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/812506
Related-Bug: #1860585
(cherry picked from commit 3f2853b9a2e6f7de16bf928721aa2b3b4fa5c801)

subject: bnr: Fixed the ERROR 1141 when users has fqdn
messages: [{'account_id': 22954, 'date': '2021-10-13 09:44:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/wallaby.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-13 20:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 22954, 'date': '2021-10-14 05:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 09:44:33.000000000', 'message': 'bnr: Fixed the ERROR 1141 when users has fqdn

When the environment is deployed with TLS-e, the galera database has the user associates to these
hosts:
 - %
 - VIP
 - FQDN

The grants for the hosts % and VIP are populated. The FQDN ones are not populated.
So when the script to backup the grant of the users is executed, it shows an
irrelevant error like:

ERROR 1141 (42000) at line 1: There is no such grant defined for user "cinder"
on host "control.internal.api.example".

This patch backs up the grants of the users associate to:
 - %
 - localhost
 - IPV4
 - IPV6

Change-Id: I2b0c9a443cc1167a0183daf59ec2db3d4fc07d74
(cherry picked from commit 669b4f019296d478581ffde5bbc89dd8a0f24747)
(cherry picked from commit dc832f3416391902af5529b5b420936ef94fc044)
'}]
commit_message:
bnr: Fixed the ERROR 1141 when users has fqdn

When the environment is deployed with TLS-e, the galera database has the user associates to these
hosts:
 - %
 - VIP
 - FQDN

The grants for the hosts % and VIP are populated. The FQDN ones are not populated.
So when the script to backup the grant of the users is executed, it shows an
irrelevant error like:

ERROR 1141 (42000) at line 1: There is no such grant defined for user "cinder"
on host "control.internal.api.example".

This patch backs up the grants of the users associate to:
 - %
 - localhost
 - IPV4
 - IPV6

Change-Id: I2b0c9a443cc1167a0183daf59ec2db3d4fc07d74
(cherry picked from commit 669b4f019296d478581ffde5bbc89dd8a0f24747)
(cherry picked from commit dc832f3416391902af5529b5b420936ef94fc044)

commit_message:
[EL9] Switch to mariadb:10.5 module

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/808496
reverted the switch to mariab:10.5 for EL 8 and 9 as it breaks
the IPA job.

mariadb:10.5 works for el9 only so making it conditional and
proceeds ahead.

Copying the changelog from
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/813642 :
- Now we've landed the patches dealing with the 10.5 user dns/naming thing
 (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/808745 and w-cherry pick)
- And now we have mariadb-10.5.12-3 which readds the wsrep_sst_rsync_tunnel back:
* Mon Oct 11 12:00:00 AM 2021 Michal Schorm <mschorm@redhat.com> - 3:10.5.12-3
- Add wsrep_sst_rsync_tunnel script

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5b474ad02da3eb52c0f2e2b5e51fc4915187be67

commit_message:
Remove use of --skip-nodes-and-networks

The depens-on removes the usage of --skip-nodes-and-networks,
instead the existing --baremtal-deployment option is used to
provide the capability to enable/disable "all-in-one" network+
node provisioning with overcloud deploy command.

Depends-On: Idaab1f28c4d645279eff0c01b24435bf8571299b
Change-Id: I00241ee91cee42770c67fa181482c6e6ad9dedf1

commit_message:
21.10 - Stable cut of charms for testing period

* use stable/21.10 libraries
* use zaza/zaza-openstack-tests at stable/21.10
* build.lock files for reactive charms
* bundles refer to ~openstack-charms candidate channel
* update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: I9f7f88fabedcd4986ce8c7e8e3542da9b1d7b099

[{'created': '2021-10-14 16:12:27.000000000', 'message': "[ceph-mon] Correct Ceph Mon Check Ports

have the proper mon_host configuration in its ceph.conf file. This
patchset adds knowledge about the v2 port also and correctly configures

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] Correct Ceph Mon Check Ports

The ceph-mon-check pod only knew about the v1 port before, and didn't
have the proper mon_host configuration in its ceph.conf file. This
patchset adds knowledge about the v2 port also and correctly configures
the ceph.conf file. Also fixes a namespace hardcoding that was found
in the last ceph-mon-check fix.

Change-Id: I460e43864a2d4b0683b67ae13bf6429d846173fc

commit_message:
Patch to add 2 parameters for controlling specific fields in EVPN rou…

…te advertisements:

tunnel_endpoint_ip: To allow for VTEP IPs other than the implicit local
router ID
mac_mobility: To insert an extended community with a sequence number
for managing MAC Mobility

Backport of https://github.com/faucetsdn/ryu/commit/5722c7c8

Story: #2009283
Task: #43619
Change-Id: I3c72752ee0894e8e1f3f9b50bbc7e8033e7efa4d

commit_message:

Without this fix, one cannot restart BGP Speaker instances

Story: #2009283
Task: #43622

messages: [{'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-10-13 12:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-13 20:44:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-10-14 07:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2021-10-14 08:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 12:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add option for RPM spec to build with ansible-core

With Ansible 2.11 we need to build collection packages and it's
not identified as "ansible", but "ansible-core". Let's add
options to build RPM either with Ansible 2.9 or Ansible-Core 2.11.

Change-Id: I0d4de1681ecfd3140cfbf14ec5adab8a9117e60c
'}]
commit_message:
Add option for RPM spec to build with ansible-core

With Ansible 2.11 we need to build collection packages and it's
not identified as "ansible", but "ansible-core". Let's add
options to build RPM either with Ansible 2.9 or Ansible-Core 2.11.

Change-Id: I0d4de1681ecfd3140cfbf14ec5adab8a9117e60c

subject: Apply ceph_conf_overrides for non-deployed_ceph services
messages: [{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-10-13 18:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-10-13 18:09:47.000000000', 'content': 'Topic bug/1946253-stable/wallaby removed'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2021-10-13 18:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to bug/1946253'}, {'account_id': 25402, 'date': '2021-10-14 06:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 18:07:18.000000000', 'message': "Apply ceph_conf_overrides for non-deployed_ceph services

When deployed_ceph is not used, all ceph_conf_overrides in
cephadm-extra-vars-heat.yml are applied during the bootstrap
process via cephadm's config assimilation. This might include
overrides needed by services like RGW which is out of scope of
deployed_ceph. When deployed_ceph is used, these configurations
were not getting applied as they missed their chance during
bootstrap which casued bug 1946253. Thus, add a new task to
assimilate configuration not just during bootstrap but any
time the tripleo_cephadm role is run.

Rename tripleo_cephadm_{bootstrap,assimilation}_conf as
it's used in assimilatiaon not just during bootstrap but
also when new configurations are added (e.g. adding RGW
to a deployed ceph cluster).

Closes-Bug: #1946253
Change-Id: Iac75ab454b3a5983f3a700f2e47d73706ec5b834
(cherry picked from commit cc47629712b2f1aea39adb5a8e60a7df1a714d99)
"}]
commit_message:
Apply ceph_conf_overrides for non-deployed_ceph services

When deployed_ceph is not used, all ceph_conf_overrides in
cephadm-extra-vars-heat.yml are applied during the bootstrap
process via cephadm's config assimilation. This might include
overrides needed by services like RGW which is out of scope of
deployed_ceph. When deployed_ceph is used, these configurations
were not getting applied as they missed their chance during
bootstrap which casued bug 1946253. Thus, add a new task to
assimilate configuration not just during bootstrap but any
time the tripleo_cephadm role is run.

Rename tripleo_cephadm_{bootstrap,assimilation}_conf as
it's used in assimilatiaon not just during bootstrap but
also when new configurations are added (e.g. adding RGW
to a deployed ceph cluster).

Closes-Bug: #1946253
Change-Id: Iac75ab454b3a5983f3a700f2e47d73706ec5b834
(cherry picked from commit cc47629712b2f1aea39adb5a8e60a7df1a714d99)

commit_message:
Use merge_configs and merge_yaml to generate Kolla configs

Supports merging configuration for the following files:

* kolla/globals.yml
* kolla/config/bifrost/bifrost.yml
* kolla/config/bifrost/dib.yml
* kolla/config/bifrost/servers.yml
* kolla/kolla-build.conf

Configuration is merged from the following sources:

* Kayobe source code
* Base Kayobe config
* Kayobe environment

Co-Authored-By: Will Szumski <will@stackhpc.com>
Change-Id: I552bd8f7853b2032954b372bf4476676dac3e271
Story: 2002009
Task: 42974

subject: add has lock judgment for OvnNbSynchronizer
messages:
[{'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-14 08:17:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-07-14 08:28:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Please, format the commit message according to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-14 09:25:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> Please, format the commit message according to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages

As the question you mentioned: "If no server has the lock to execute the sync methods, we'll never execute them", I think the first restart neutron server can successfully "OvnNbSynchronizer", becase the IDL "OvnNbSynchronizer" is delayed for 10 seconds, which is just the time for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" successful locking.
Of course, I have another question. Can the same IDL request two locks, one for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" and the other for "OvnNbSynchronizer"。'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-07-14 10:09:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/800751/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 32m 22s'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-14 10:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-07-14 11:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > (1 comment)
> > 
> > Please, format the commit message according to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages
> 
> As the question you mentioned: "If no server has the lock to execute the sync methods, we'll never execute them", I think the first restart neutron server can successfully "OvnNbSynchronizer", becase the IDL "OvnNbSynchronizer" is delayed for 10 seconds, which is just the time for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" successful locking.
> Of course, I have another question. Can the same IDL request two locks, one for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" and the other for "OvnNbSynchronizer"。

Right, "Ovn*Synchronizer" classes sync methods are executed before the "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" methods.

Now this raises another problem: you are asking for a lock in the NB IDL that is set in "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics", AFTER using the NB IDL in "OvnNbSynchronizer" [1]

What I suggest is, because you are checking for a lock in this IDL, to set if before using it in "OvnNbSynchronizer", just before [2].

About having two locks in the same IDL instance, lock_name is unique [3]. Can be None or something else, but we can't have more than one.

[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py#L138-L139
[2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L335
[3]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/d2e97030eda5dfafc875ec056788c49e2570d2ef/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L168'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-14 12:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> >

> > > 
> > > (1 comment)
> > > 
> > > Please, format the commit message according to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages
> > 
> > As the question you mentioned: "If no server has the lock to execute the sync methods, we'll never execute them", I think the first restart neutron server can successfully "OvnNbSynchronizer", becase the IDL "OvnNbSynchronizer" is delayed for 10 seconds, which is just the time for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" successful locking.
> > Of course, I have another question. Can the same IDL request two locks, one for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" and the other for "OvnNbSynchronizer"。
> 
> Right, "Ovn*Synchronizer" classes sync methods are executed before the "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" methods.
> 
> Now this raises another problem: you are asking for a lock in the NB IDL that is set in "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics", AFTER using the NB IDL in "OvnNbSynchronizer" [1]
> 
> What I suggest is, because you are checking for a lock in this IDL, to set if before using it in "OvnNbSynchronizer", just before [2].
> 
> About having two locks in the same IDL instance, lock_name is unique [3]. Can be None or something else, but we can't have more than one.
> 
> [1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py#L138-L139
> [2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L335
> [3]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/d2e97030eda5dfafc875ec056788c49e2570d2ef/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L168

Do you mean I move the lock of IDL to the front, such as this place [1], before the original position[2]?


[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L317

> > > As the question you mentioned: "If no server has the lock to execute the sync methods, we'll never execute them", I think the first restart neutron server can successfully "OvnNbSynchronizer", becase the IDL "OvnNbSynchronizer" is delayed for 10 seconds, which is just the time for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" successful locking.
> > > Of course, I have another question. Can the same IDL request two locks, one for "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" and the other for "OvnNbSynchronizer"。
> > 
> > Right, "Ovn*Synchronizer" classes sync methods are executed before the "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics" methods.
> > 
> > Now this raises another problem: you are asking for a lock in the NB IDL that is set in "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics", AFTER using the NB IDL in "OvnNbSynchronizer" [1]
> > 
> > What I suggest is, because you are checking for a lock in this IDL, to set if before using it in "OvnNbSynchronizer", just before [2].
> > 
> > About having two locks in the same IDL instance, lock_name is unique [3]. Can be None or something else, but we can't have more than one.
> > 
> > [1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py#L138-L139
> > [2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L335
> > [3]https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/d2e97030eda5dfafc875ec056788c49e2570d2ef/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L168
> 
> Do you mean I move the lock of IDL to the front, such as this place [1], before the original position[2]?
> 
> 
> [1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L317
> 
> [2]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py#L138-L139

Not to [1] because that will affect to any other worker, but to [0], just before instantiating OvnNbSynchronizer. And yes, remove them from [2].

[0]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/3cae410b3094e74549a1941e0b7d833229ae51d5/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py#L333'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-15 01:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32020, 'date': '2021-07-15 01:34:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
add has lock judgment for OvnNbSynchronizer

In "DBInconsistenciesPeriodics", we set a lock named "ovn_db_inconsistencies_periodics".
This class methods check the lock status but not the OvnNbSynchronizer" class,
sharing the same NB_IDL.
Because of that, see the txn.NOT_LOCKED errors in some servers and keep printing.

Closes-Bug: #1935888

Change-Id: I3581053f5ea5fecd6a32b193efc8f7055605ca73

> Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1
> 
> It would be nice if we could do some scale testing just to verify this doesn't have a negative effect, but I think at least other than active/passive replication it'll be ok.

I did test with creation of 1000 ports on my local, singlenode devstack. I used simple script like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/805782/ to do that.
I then run that script on current master branch (without this patch), later removed all those ports and networks, apply this patch and run it again. Results are available at https://i.imgur.com/pKFLhPv.png

It seems that we shouldn't go with that approach, at least now.
Maybe we should restore Daniel's old patch and create PGs per subnet then? Wdyt?"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2021-05-31 08:45:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> > Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1
> > 
> > It would be nice if we could do some scale testing just to verify this doesn't have a negative effect, but I think at least other than active/passive replication it'll be ok.
> 
> I did test with creation of 1000 ports on my local, singlenode devstack. I used simple script like: http://paste.openstack.org/show/805782/ to do that.
> I then run that script on current master branch (without this patch), later removed all those ports and networks, apply this patch and run it again. Results are available at https://i.imgur.com/pKFLhPv.png
> 
> It seems that we shouldn't go with that approach, at least now.
> Maybe we should restore Daniel's old patch and create PGs per subnet then? Wdyt?

Thanks, everything is much easier with data!! :) Slaweq++
I think this can be even worse if instead of just creating the ports we try to boot VMs and ping them since northd and SB server will be busy as well while here it's pretty much NB stuff.

We can restore my code and repeat your tests to see how it goes?"}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2021-07-27 19:53:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Terry Wilson <twilson@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-28 21:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Fix DHCP acls for ML2/OVN backend

Closes-Bug: #1926515
Change-Id: I9fe7be517abbaf50b55192e72673d7480e05ba77
'}, {'created': '2021-04-29 13:51:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix DHCP acls for ML2/OVN backend

Probably during switch to port groups usage of the add_acl_dhcp function
was somehow dropped and due to that dhcp requests which were comming out
from the VM were blocked if there was no any other SG rule which would
allow that traffic.
Usually it isn't problem as by default SG has rules to allow all egress
traffic but if such rules would be deleted from SG, then VM can't get IP
address from the DHCP anymore.

commit_message:
Fix DHCP acls for ML2/OVN backend

Probably during switch to port groups usage of the add_acl_dhcp function
was somehow dropped and due to that dhcp requests which were comming out
from the VM were blocked if there was no any other SG rule which would
allow that traffic.
Usually it isn't problem as by default SG has rules to allow all egress
traffic but if such rules would be deleted from SG, then VM can't get IP
address from the DHCP anymore.

It's now fixed in the similar way like it is done for e.g. iptables or
openvswitch firewall driver in ML2/OVS case. Extra port group with ACL
to allow such DHCP requests is created, it's very similar to
neutron_pg_drop port group. Next, each port is added to that specific
port group to have allowed egress DHCP requests.

Closes-Bug: #1926515
Change-Id: I9fe7be517abbaf50b55192e72673d7480e05ba77

commit_message:
Enable querier for multicast (IGMP) in OVN

This patch is adding IGMP querier support in the OVN driver.
IGMP querier is working only when IGMP snooping is enable.

Closes-Bug: #1917437
Change-Id: I797060905974fccc4651c52a5a42f194b7f15242

commit_message:
Create neutron_pg_drop Port Group on init

The patch adds a short living connection in pre-fork routine that
creates neutron_pg_drop Port Group. Later after workers are spawned,
each worker also creates a short living connection and waits for an
event that the Port Group was created.

The short living IDLs limit its tables only for relevant tables so it
doesn't fetch the whole OVS DB to the local copy.

Closes-bug: #1866068

 Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
	neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Change-Id: I1f5af36b8c3d5650f890edfed3c33dc206869824
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d7c23431ad3959eb5fd74e42ea95d446e4e7566d)

commit_message:
stable-only: Fix network segment allocation logic

When we get a list of segments to choose from, and the first segment is
already allocated, it fails right away returning RetryRequest exception,
the the other segments are never tried out.

This changes fixes that logic by trying all segments on the segments
list before failing. Also fixes the logic of the tests that weren't
enabling the network_segments_range plugin properly.

Closes-Bug: #1940312
Signed-off-by: Thiago Brito <thiago.brito@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I205e01b8506cce4c6abdeb59b54fb1c90625c7e0

subject: Do less locking on l3 agent greenpool resize
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-08-27 07:49:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

In CPython, threads (OS threads, green threads) are *never* executed in parallel. And when using green threads, that are not preemptive, we know that this thread will have the Python GIL until this thread actively release it; that means we know the method will be completely executed without interruption.

With green threads, we don't have competing threads waiting for other threads locks. And if we switch to OS threads, the current implementation will ensure the pool size is correctly calculated."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2021-08-27 08:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> In CPython, threads (OS threads, green threads) are *never* executed in parallel. And when using green threads, that are not preemptive, we know that this thread will have the Python GIL until this thread actively release it; that means we know the method will be completely executed without interruption.
> 
> With green threads, we don't have competing threads waiting for other threads locks. And if we switch to OS threads, the current implementation will ensure the pool size is correctly calculated.

I see the main problem in the locking. Adding or deleting each router calls to _pool_resize that first tries to grab the syncronized lock regardless of whether the pool will be actually resized or not. Here's a part of Guru Meditation report (from Queens) during l3 agent doing full sync of ~300 routers.

  ------                        Green Thread                        ------

/var/lib/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/greenthread.py:214 in main
    `result = function(*args, **kwargs)`

/var/lib/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:267 in inner
    `do_log=False, semaphores=semaphores, delay=delay):`

/usr/lib/python2.7/contextlib.py:17 in __enter__
    `return self.gen.next()`

/var/lib/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:210 in lock
    `with int_lock:`

/usr/lib/python2.7/threading.py:468 in acquire
    `self.__cond.wait()`

/usr/lib/python2.7/threading.py:340 in wait
    `waiter.acquire()`

/var/lib/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/semaphore.py:113 in acquire
    `hubs.get_hub().switch()`

/var/lib/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/eventlet/hubs/hub.py:294 in switch
    `return self.greenlet.switch()`

and I have about 900 of those :-/"}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-08-27 08:37:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2021-08-27 09:25:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/806325/1 : SUCCESS in 1h 48m 43s'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-08-31 14:38:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM to avoid needless locks'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-08-31 14:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

+1 as I agree we better have a bug with problem description'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-10-14 16:13:53.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-27 07:36:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do less locking on l3 agent greenpool resize

currently each pool resize attempt tries to grab a syncronized lock,
even if it will actually do not resize the pool in the end.

Due to this, when max pool size is reached, agent may spawn many
greenthreads that all at once are trying to grab the lock, hogging
resources, which is particularly noticible on full sync of large enough
number of routers.

This patch does attempt to grab the lock only if the pool is actually
going to be resized.

Change-Id: I31bbe1e8a8891dfdfb06e78dbe03aecfbc419214
'}]
commit_message:
Do less locking on l3 agent greenpool resize

currently each pool resize attempt tries to grab a syncronized lock,
even if it will actually do not resize the pool in the end.

Due to this, when max pool size is reached, agent may spawn many
greenthreads that all at once are trying to grab the lock, hogging
resources, which is particularly noticible on full sync of large enough
number of routers.

This patch does attempt to grab the lock only if the pool is actually
going to be resized.

Change-Id: I31bbe1e8a8891dfdfb06e78dbe03aecfbc419214

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32792, 'date': '2021-09-02 05:56:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We found that the problem has been resolved in https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/b2b9fd66b9e673a4cbc43258ab0ac306db2f38d1

The routes are added by keepalived (not by openstack with function RouterInfo.update_routing_table(operation, route) from router_info.py) when router in HA mode. But keepalived 1.X (at Ubuntu 18 that used in our environment) can not add route when used "no_track" option in the route string of the keepalive config file. RouterInfo.update_routing_table(operation, route) function is failed for external routes with error "Nexthop has invalid gateway" but it not affects when keepalived works correctly.
The routes are added by openstack with function RouterInfo.update_routing_table(operation, route) from router_info.py) successfully when the router used in single mode.
 So this patch is not actual for our environment. 
 If there are other reasons for fix work RouterInfo.update_routing_table(operation, route) function, than I will write the unit tests for this function. If there are no reason, than this patch is not needed'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-10-14 16:13:42.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment, and failed Zuul jobs the last time it was checked. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and leaving a 'recheck' comment to get fresh test results."}]

commit_message:
Remove the 'port_object' unneeded parameter

This parameter was used to keep things backwards compatible. It is not
needed since the Rocky release. This removal causes a problem since
port_object was still in use on the qos.py functions and in a DNS
related transaction. To fix this, new constants have been added as
externals IDs in the OVN table. Tests are also changed accordingly.

Change-Id: I46c2e47a9b506cff98d989b94951399bfaf0bb09
Signed-off-by: Elvira García Ruiz <egarciar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use 2 DHCP agents per network in TestHAL3Agent

This is a workaround for privsep hanging issue described in
bug #1930401.

Once a proper fix is merged, this patch will be reverted.

This patch mimics [1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/795300

Related-Bug: #1942190
Related-Bug: #1930401
Related-Bug: #1862315

Change-Id: I5a8c50eea4f52fcefed26e132063022bb1c81a78

commit_message:
Run neutron-tempest-plugin scenario slow tests serially

Tempest (depends-on patch) is adding a new run-tempest role
variable to pass the extra args for running the tempest test.

With the new var 'tempest_extra_args', this commit adds regex
for scenario test job so that all the slow marked tests will
run serially and rest other in parallel.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tempest/+/807790

Change-Id: I575d460ed02a41fe007c2cbf919b5da15d6f14df

messages:
[{'account_id': 14525, 'date': '2021-09-09 20:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2021-09-10 01:07:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Thanks for the information, I had a look of it on the original bug/1859832. IMO, you should add a new bug for that issue "Backup to Master might takes an hours". Some valuable information for new bug are logs, config options, the neutron version of your deployment, and how to reproduce it.

And something more is about the resource pressure. How many routers your L3-agent handled? How many ports on your single network node? IMO, mostly you are experiencing resource capacity limitation.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-10-14 16:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This review is > 4 weeks without comment and currently blocked by a core reviewer with a -2. We are abandoning this for now. Feel free to reactivate the review by pressing the restore button and contacting the reviewer with the -2 on this review to ensure you address their concerns.'}]

'}, {'created': '2021-10-14 14:19:17.000000000', 'message': 'DNM - chore(backup): updates backup script

As the backup script can be executed via the cron job or "manually" (via
utility container), it would be good to be able to distinguish the mode
of backup in the filename. This patch set adds in .${MODE} in the
filename to distinguish if it is automatic vs. manual.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <t@lam.wtf>
Change-Id: I6bf5b1908cad1459115797b2d9f2171f599b6f38
'}]
commit_message:
DNM - chore(backup): updates backup script

As the backup script can be executed via the cron job or "manually" (via
utility container), it would be good to be able to distinguish the mode
of backup in the filename. This patch set adds in .${MODE} in the
filename to distinguish if it is automatic vs. manual.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <t@lam.wtf>
Change-Id: I6bf5b1908cad1459115797b2d9f2171f599b6f38

21.10 - Stable cut of charms for testing period

* use stable/21.10 libraries
* use zaza/zaza-openstack-tests at stable/21.10
* build.lock files for reactive charms
* bundles refer to ~openstack-charms candidate channel

commit_message:
Fix the validations_log_basedir overriding

The patch [1] doesn't work and the validations execution logs are
located in /home/stack/validations by default instead of
/var/log/validations directory.

This patch fixes this issue by overriding correctly the
'validation_log_dir' default value for the run, show history and show
run sub commands.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/794577

Related-bz: rhbz#2013575
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic9de63514086d660cfbe87ef6539935366036941

commit_message:
drop resource_restart_flag

With the removal of the last non-bundle implementation of manila
we can remove the resource_restart_flag() mechanism which was used
to signal the restart of non-bundle services.

Change-Id: I3bf4db1d85429e98c948d7ee049cfa78b8956fe0

[{'created': '2021-10-11 14:39:55.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor usage of QemuMemoryBackingDir

Currently the QemuMemoryBackingDir parameter is used in two templates
for modular libvirt daemon. The common template defines container
volumes while the modular-libvirt template defines puppet hieradata.

This change migrate the second usage to the common template so that
we can more easily maintain the parameter in the single place.

Change-Id: I3bcd73f0dc97af4d3160313693cb1af9bccabede

commit_message:
Refactor usage of QemuMemoryBackingDir

Currently the QemuMemoryBackingDir parameter is used in two templates
for modular libvirt daemon. The common template defines container
volumes while the modular-libvirt template defines puppet hieradata.

This change migrate the second usage to the common template so that
we can more easily maintain the parameter in the single place.

Change-Id: I3bcd73f0dc97af4d3160313693cb1af9bccabede

[{'created': '2021-09-22 17:32:05.000000000', 'message': "Implement project personas in custom neutron policy file

This commit updates the default neutron policies in
enable-secure-rbac.yaml to implement consistent support for project
personas (project-admin, project-member, and project-reader) with other
OpenStack services. The project-admin is still considered a system
administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases (likely Yoga) when we have
a community wide goal to finish system-scope adoption. At that point, we
can remove these overrides and use the defaults in neutron, which adhere to
system and project personas and we'll get more functionality without these
overrides.

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom neutron policy file

This commit updates the default neutron policies in
enable-secure-rbac.yaml to implement consistent support for project
personas (project-admin, project-member, and project-reader) with other
OpenStack services. The project-admin is still considered a system
administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases (likely Yoga) when we have
a community wide goal to finish system-scope adoption. At that point, we
can remove these overrides and use the defaults in neutron, which adhere to
system and project personas and we'll get more functionality without these
overrides.

Change-Id: Ie2273adbdf0dda7947e570933aaca661aa8a67da

Allow LVM filter to work when either allowlist or denylist are empty

Fixes the LVM filter task for it to build correctly formatted lists
when either one of allowlist or denylist are empty.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 13:40:11.000000000', 'message': 'Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the timeout
given to the managed podman action + 1 sec. Then if it expires, kill
its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group) before rerunning the
same operation. Also note that using KilMode process is not recommended
by systemd man pages.

Change-Id: I6d0309e5e38a1b1d0b29768ab86592be26d09629
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Wrap stopping podman -t with systemd timeouts

Currently with KillMode=none, if podman -t hangs, the command repeats
leaving the process and its cgroup around.
But if a stop/start command hangs, we should not start another one.

Instead time it out properly via TimeoutStopSec set to the timeout
given to the managed podman action + 1 sec. Then if it expires, kill
its cgroup all the way (KillMode=control-group) before rerunning the
same operation. Also note that using KilMode process is not recommended
by systemd man pages.

Change-Id: I6d0309e5e38a1b1d0b29768ab86592be26d09629
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2021-09-23 14:02:22.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate GenericHardwareDeclarativePollster

This pollster was designed to be used in a TripleO deployment, to
gather hardware metrics from overcloud nodes. However in current
TripleO deployment Telemetry services are no longer deployed in
undercloud thus this pollster is useless.

'}, {'created': '2021-09-23 14:12:46.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate GenericHardwareDeclarativePollster

commit_message:
Deprecate GenericHardwareDeclarativePollster

This pollster was designed to be used in a TripleO deployment, to
gather hardware metrics from overcloud nodes. However in current
TripleO deployment Telemetry services are no longer deployed in
undercloud thus this pollster is useless.

Change-Id: Ic7d6b0adbbe9b33bc9421add849c49cf7ef823e0

subject: Fix inconsistent spec file name
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-13 23:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-14 13:19:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-10-14 13:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 23:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix inconsistent spec file name

A spec files should be named following name of the puppet class it
tests. This change fixes the wrong spec file name which tests
the octavia::provider::ovn class. Its current name assumes the spec
file tests the octavia::ovn::provider class.

Change-Id: I0e5728208c8ea62a73b10b555ca409aabf0142af
'}]
commit_message:
Fix inconsistent spec file name

A spec files should be named following name of the puppet class it
tests. This change fixes the wrong spec file name which tests
the octavia::provider::ovn class. Its current name assumes the spec
file tests the octavia::ovn::provider class.

Change-Id: I0e5728208c8ea62a73b10b555ca409aabf0142af

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
messages: [{'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-10-14 12:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-10-14 12:31:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 12:20:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8c2db2e1c904dc78c18cfd91a3ff3ece958863fb
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I8c2db2e1c904dc78c18cfd91a3ff3ece958863fb

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I5ec222dde45ed36b70547f4d03612e91fc2ea02e

commit_message:
Restore reproducibility in docs

The documentation is writting the date in its copyright. This is
considered bad practice, because this kills reproducibility. If
you don't know about reproducible build, please read on:
  https://reproducible-builds.org/

Change-Id: I5a837a94468ce151e6dc24a01c238cd98d67e99b

commit_message:
Restore reproducibility in docs

The documentation is writting the date in its copyright. This is
considered bad practice, because this kills reproducibility. If
you don't know about reproducible build, please read on:

https: //reproducible-builds.org/
Change-Id: I6427c83af06ac58da32898f00d3f99dc6ba1ae93

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-09-08 16:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

Greetings! I'm okay with a lot of what is here, except the iter_nodes helper... for which I have concerns.

I hope I've kind of outlined them. I *do* see the value, but I think the pattern was copied off of what is likely a bad base of the redfish steps which are also modified in this patch. Those steps in particular look like they pull a task prematurely which is in-efficient db wise as they pull a task prior to evaluating the last item on the row they request from manager.iter_nodes, which then causes the node to skip the task. We've already had complaints of excessively high query numbers in the likes of CERN and other operators just explicitly short circuit periodic workers when not absolutely needed as a matter of practice.

I guess where I'm going with this is we need to proceed carefully and maybe provide another mean or tool to help try and keep this pattern as database friendly as possible."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-09-09 14:52:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

We chatted with Julia; I'll try to come up with a proposal that will also solve some scalability issues."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-09-10 07:44:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add and document high-level helpers for async steps

The pattern we use right now is too verbose to even put in
documentation. This change adds two more helpers:
* deploy_utils.prepare_agent_boot replaces the omnipresent 2-line
  snippet around task.boot.prepare_ramdisk.
* deploy_utils.reboot_to_finish_step adds rebooting to it.

Change-Id: I88540268d3bacebda775a0e94015c29a82c2c6a0

subject: Add a helper for node-based periodics

commit_message:
Add a helper for node-based periodics

We have a very common pattern of periodic tasks that use iter_nodes
to fetch some nodes, check them, create a task and conductor some
operation. This change introduces a helper decorator for that and
migrates the drivers to it.

I'm intentionally leaving unit tests intact to demonstrate that the
new decorator works exactly the same way (modulo cosmetic changes)
as the previous hand-written code.

Change-Id: Ifed4a457275d9451cc412dc80f3c09df72f50492
Story: #2009203
Task: #43522

commit_message:
requirements: Uncap prettytable, remove l-c

Fix the requirements job by uncapping this dependency. The upper cap
will now be managed by global-requirements like everything else.

Since we're modifying the requirements, the requirements job are run and
we see that the lower-constraints job is failing. Remove this job and
related artefacts also.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I09bdc40e34b219c6bdf880d2511585a921018477

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6991f30b92076a7b72dbaee85072b3a372fa6ca3

subject: Catch ConnectionForced Exception
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-07 09:23:24.000000000', 'message': "Catch ConnectionForced Exception

Occasionally I saw large number of connectionforced exceptions.
such exceptions cannot be healed automatically and requires a reboot.
catch it and ensure connection established.

Changes:
  oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

NOTE(stephenfin): We need to add the 'absolute_import' future to disable
the legacy import flow. Without this, the import of 'amqp.exceptions' in
'oslo_messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit' attempts to import 'exceptions'
from the sibling module, 'oslo_messaging._drivers.amqp', instead of the
top-level 'amqp' module. Thank God for Python 3.x, eh? More information
is available at [1], for those curious enough.

NOTE(hberaud): conflicts within the cherry-pick on stable/stein due to
removed log translation and i18n on stable/train [2]. I decided to
ignore this patch [2] for stable/stein first to prepare cherry-picking
on previous stable branches (rocky, queens) and secondly because I
don't think we want it on older branches.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/q/33743880/
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/4f385720d7d43aadfaff7c6f41b0534312b23ba8

Change-Id: I5c468d10230f05438df780e045f1e92662edf070

commit_message:
Catch ConnectionForced Exception

Occasionally I saw large number of connectionforced exceptions.
such exceptions cannot be healed automatically and requires a reboot.
catch it and ensure connection established.

Changes:
  oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

NOTE(stephenfin): We need to add the 'absolute_import' future to disable
the legacy import flow. Without this, the import of 'amqp.exceptions' in
'oslo_messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit' attempts to import 'exceptions'
from the sibling module, 'oslo_messaging._drivers.amqp', instead of the
top-level 'amqp' module. Thank God for Python 3.x, eh? More information
is available at [1], for those curious enough.

NOTE(hberaud): conflicts within the cherry-pick on stable/stein due to
removed log translation and i18n on stable/train [2]. I decided to
ignore this patch [2] for stable/stein first to prepare cherry-picking
on previous stable branches (rocky, queens) and secondly because I
don't think we want it on older branches.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/q/33743880/
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/4f385720d7d43aadfaff7c6f41b0534312b23ba8

Change-Id: I5c468d10230f05438df780e045f1e92662edf070
Closes-Bug: #1883038
(cherry picked from commit 26e8bb4cc9097fddf3c2e34599b131e3f5d73867)
(cherry picked from commit 360deb89a7e95d332267564b486219e389a793f7)
(cherry picked from commit 54ced5361b49fb9b0cf53ff2e6f5825ba7ae513a)

commit_message:
Catch ConnectionForced Exception

Occasionally I saw large number of connectionforced exceptions.
such exceptions cannot be healed automatically and requires a reboot.
catch it and ensure connection established.

Changes:
  oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py

NOTE(stephenfin): We need to add the 'absolute_import' future to disable
the legacy import flow. Without this, the import of 'amqp.exceptions' in
'oslo_messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit' attempts to import 'exceptions'
from the sibling module, 'oslo_messaging._drivers.amqp', instead of the
top-level 'amqp' module. Thank God for Python 3.x, eh? More information
is available at [1], for those curious enough.

NOTE(hberaud): conflicts within the cherry-pick on stable/stein due to
removed log translation and i18n on stable/train [2]. I decided to
ignore this patch [2] for stable/stein first to prepare cherry-picking
on previous stable branches (rocky, queens) and secondly because I
don't think we want it on older branches.

[1] https://stackoverflow.com/q/33743880/
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/4f385720d7d43aadfaff7c6f41b0534312b23ba8

commit_message:
[stable/train] Add support for the validations skip list feature

This patch adds a new --skiplist argument to the run sub command.

This feature allows the operator to provide a file with a list of
Validations to skip via the run sub command.

More details could be found in the official validations-libs
documentation [1].

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/validations-libs/+/809289

[1] - https://docs.openstack.org/validations-libs/latest/readme.html#skip-list
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I150fca87293fc879f32ab31da6e687a9ebf4057c

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib68cc2dfa44c1984725e40f49ecbd96c460fbc3e

commit_message:
Add a retry to the instropection waiting workbook

The workbook wait_for_introspection_to_finish needs a retry and a delay
to avoid issues in some deployments

related bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1999539

Change-Id: I2a23f33868ad71f6385403dbcb7353d1158d9e5a
(cherry picked from commit b02ad2618639ef39bd03c58d845ac8091d9bb90a)

commit_message:
bnr: Fixed the ERROR 1141 when users has fqdn

When the environment is deployed with TLS-e, the galera database has the user associates to these
hosts:
 - %
 - VIP
 - FQDN

The grants for the hosts % and VIP are populated. The FQDN ones are not populated.
So when the script to backup the grant of the users is executed, it shows an
irrelevant error like:

ERROR 1141 (42000) at line 1: There is no such grant defined for user "cinder"
on host "control.internal.api.example".

This patch backs up the grants of the users associate to:
 - %
 - localhost
 - IPV4
 - IPV6

Change-Id: I2b0c9a443cc1167a0183daf59ec2db3d4fc07d74
(cherry picked from commit 669b4f019296d478581ffde5bbc89dd8a0f24747)

[{'created': '2021-10-06 13:41:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Remove stack_update check in rabbit manifest

Since we have ephemeral heat the stack_update hiera key is always
set to CREATE anyway so it will never work.

We can drop it because we have the puppet collectors running that
after rabbitmq_ready so rabbitmq is up.

Change-Id: If3d16b8510175ed9fae2813fbdc7248402639e78
'}, {'created': '2021-10-13 06:46:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove stack_update check in rabbit manifest

Since we have ephemeral heat the stack_update hiera key is always
set to CREATE anyway so it will never work.

We can drop it because we have the puppet collectors running that
after rabbitmq_ready so rabbitmq is up in the HA case.

For the non-HA case (rabbitmq on the undercloud) we run rabbitmq
via docker_config at step_1 and then enforce the rabbitmq_user class
during container_puppet_tasks (rabbitmq_init_tasks) during step 2,
so we're guaranteed that rabbitmq is up.

Change-Id: If3d16b8510175ed9fae2813fbdc7248402639e78
"}]
commit_message:
Remove stack_update check in rabbit manifest

Since we have ephemeral heat the stack_update hiera key is always
set to CREATE anyway so it will never work.

We can drop it because we have the puppet collectors running that
after rabbitmq_ready so rabbitmq is up in the HA case.

For the non-HA case (rabbitmq on the undercloud) we run rabbitmq
via docker_config at step_1 and then enforce the rabbitmq_user class
during container_puppet_tasks (rabbitmq_init_tasks) during step 2,
so we're guaranteed that rabbitmq is up.

Change-Id: If3d16b8510175ed9fae2813fbdc7248402639e78

[{'created': '2021-10-13 14:56:47.000000000', 'message': "oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Also, os_vif now supports list_opts
(I7fc132f917949d147dd6371d54e01a6cfd995aae) so we can use it to template
the vif_plug_(ovs|linux_bridge) sections. As opposed to cinder, there's
no reference section so we need to statically define them.

commit_message:
partial-backport: oslo-config-validator: Removing merged patches

While developing this, we discovered a lot of inconsistencies across the
openstack projects. These inconsistencies are now fixed, at least on the
master branch so we can now remove them from the exceptions.

This change I70ab87c9bed093cad883b6301b8a09753fc470d9 was merged so the
yaml bug we found in the generator is now fixed across all the branches.
It's now safe to remove the builtin patch.

Partial-Backport: Some of the changes were not backported before W

Change-Id: I6f86ce6b135be9841b5fcae1f940c829327a2db2
(cherry picked from commit 63f881be6e759e91b008fa25894bd07e1403dbf3)
(cherry picked from commit d91ed58a6015acdf509bd7d8bbc0287f5a314ca8)

[{'created': '2021-10-13 14:56:43.000000000', 'message': 'oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

commit_message:
oslo-config-validator: invalidating configs only when necessary

Some nodes with no settings to invalidate as per their role will have
an empty config_invalidations list thus breaking the related tasks and
returning an error.

Skipping these tasks when config_invalidations is undefined will prevent
this false negative and will not block other nodes from runnnig the
tasks.

Also, adding some defaults to prevent failures when items are missing
from config.

Change-Id: Ib3ca74caf747c13937a4efa8c20a6fd789ede43b
(cherry picked from commit 9c62de3d4c5f0c78445b450da917a6183e81f93b)
(cherry picked from commit 6d8ea31cbcda2cc915350eb3152c6ea9466a925a)
