revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-14 00:23:56.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-client] Fix ceph-rbd-pool deletion race

In cases where the pool deletion feature [0] is used, but the pool does
not exists, a pool is created and then subsequently deleted.

This was broken by the performance optimizations introduced with [1], as
the job is trying to delete a pool that does not exist (yet).

This change makes the ceph-rbd-pool job wait for manage_pools to finish
before trying to delete the pool.

0: https://review.opendev.org/c/792851
1: https://review.opendev.org/c/806443

Change-Id: Ibb77e33bed834be25ec7fd215bc448e62075f52a
'}]
commit_message:
[ceph-client] Fix ceph-rbd-pool deletion race

In cases where the pool deletion feature [0] is used, but the pool does
not exists, a pool is created and then subsequently deleted.

This was broken by the performance optimizations introduced with [1], as
the job is trying to delete a pool that does not exist (yet).

This change makes the ceph-rbd-pool job wait for manage_pools to finish
before trying to delete the pool.

0: https://review.opendev.org/c/792851
1: https://review.opendev.org/c/806443

Change-Id: Ibb77e33bed834be25ec7fd215bc448e62075f52a

Adding collections to meta will prevent failure as well as keeping the
code clean and concise.

also rewriting mock code because it doesn't work with collections.

[{'created': '2021-10-12 12:08:28.000000000', 'message': 'Allow customizing separator for ini file

The api-paste.ini accepts not only "=" but also ":" and some services
like Barbican have been using ":" for their default api-paste.ini
files.

[composite:main]
use = egg:Paste#urlmap
/: barbican_version
/v1: barbican-api-keystone

This change introduces the logic to pick up separator from resource
definition, so that we can implement resource parameters to use
different separators.

Change-Id: I21ab398f5d4f96673f3e2060263a9ba6691fef98
'}]
commit_message:
Allow customizing separator for ini file

The api-paste.ini accepts not only "=" but also ":" and some services
like Barbican have been using ":" for their default api-paste.ini
files.

[composite:main]
use = egg:Paste#urlmap
/: barbican_version
/v1: barbican-api-keystone

This change introduces the logic to pick up separator from resource
definition, so that we can implement resource parameters to use
different separators.

Change-Id: I21ab398f5d4f96673f3e2060263a9ba6691fef98

commit_message:
Fix how disallow_iframe_embed is defined

The disallow_iframe_embed option doesn't belong to HORIZON_CONFIG but
should be described as a variable in local_settings.

Closes-Bug: #1942722
Change-Id: I189fbb0a76ba63e16f6c3b6ad9db6f9e0355617f
(cherry picked from commit 7153d5cdfac9288bca22caedb064ea5aa903c2eb)
(cherry picked from commit 7135e8d99d6e11522006291c224e88a87a4e942b)

commit_message:
Remove bind cookbook from Berksfile and fix version pin

The bind cookbook has been migrated to the Sous Chefs and a new release has
finally been done which removes the need to have this in the pointer (which is
now broken).

In addition, update cacert which is shipped in the python requests package on
RHEL to work around expired LetsEncrypt root certificate.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/813719
Change-Id: Id537867e47ed54c7028abf7037b251077e57de64
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
Create a separate class to manage the trustee options

This change introduces the new heat::trustee class to manage
the parameters in the [trustee] options. These options have been set
according to authtoken parameters but it makes maintenance complicated
and the logic doesn't work properly when noauth is used.

This change also removes the [trustee] project_domain_name parameter
because the parameter has never been used actually.

Change-Id: I694a8ea771cc4d4dcfbf8384ece2be10d83ab3f0

The bind cookbook has been migrated to the Sous Chefs and a new release has
finally been done which removes the need to have this in the pointer (which is
now broken).

In addition:

- Disable voting for other issues that need to be addressed
- Add CHEF_PRODUCT_NAME env var to kitchen.yml to allow users of Cinc to use it

commit_message:
Remove bind cookbook from Berksfile

The bind cookbook has been migrated to the Sous Chefs and a new release has
finally been done which removes the need to have this in the pointer (which is
now broken).

In addition:

- Disable voting for other issues that need to be addressed
- Add CHEF_PRODUCT_NAME env var to kitchen.yml to allow users of Cinc to use it
  more easily

Change-Id: I2a58f3633f0e5cd2457ebcb09feaa3c848a7513c
Signed-off-by: Lance Albertson <lance@osuosl.org>

commit_message:
Add support for [DEFAULT] mkisofs_cmd

Since genisoimage is no longuer maintained, RHEL/CentOS family
is going toward xorriso path which provides dropin replacement.

While mkisofs command is either a symlink to alternatives (rhel)
or to genisoimage (debian), we should control this parameter and
install appropriate package.

Conflicts:
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/nova_compute_spec.rb

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2002949
Closes-Bug: #1945051
Change-Id: Id20319ca2c5d4b458b566ca878ca83db51d240e1
(cherry picked from commit f6636b77275dc2116e959c6d64abd9f6159da0ee)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-03 20:42:39.000000000', 'message': 'Always run growvols playbook after provision

Just like cli-overcloud-node-network-config.yaml,
cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml will be run by the "openstack
overcloud node provision" directly after provisioning so that whole
disk images will have their /var volume grown to 100%.

This default growvols behaviour can be overridden by adding an
ansible_playbooks entry which sets different arguments:

- count: 3
  name: Controller
  ansible_playbooks:
  - playbook: /usr/share/ansible/tripleo-playbooks/cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml
    extra_vars:
      growvols_args: /var=50% /srv=50%

Other changes in this commit include:
- Always call run_role_playbooks and pass network_config as an
  argument
- Full unit test coverage on run_role_playbooks
- Fix run_role_playbook using os.path.basename instead of os.path.dirname

Change-Id: I085ab9da30e1e1a7d2b9a9f230dd0275bd40480d
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Depends-On: I0a847ad4077a02a02ad817dd189a6a31c3637a93
(cherry picked from commit 3f303b907ba55f526a4e15a4c7b29698c37dcf52)

commit_message:
Always run growvols playbook after provision

Just like cli-overcloud-node-network-config.yaml,
cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml will be run by the "openstack
overcloud node provision" directly after provisioning so that whole
disk images will have their /var volume grown to 100%.

This default growvols behaviour can be overridden by adding an
ansible_playbooks entry which sets different arguments:

- count: 3
  name: Controller
  ansible_playbooks:
  - playbook: /usr/share/ansible/tripleo-playbooks/cli-overcloud-node-growvols.yaml
    extra_vars:
      growvols_args: /var=50% /srv=50%

Other changes in this commit include:
- Always call run_role_playbooks and pass network_config as an
  argument
- Full unit test coverage on run_role_playbooks
- Fix run_role_playbook using os.path.basename instead of os.path.dirname

Change-Id: I085ab9da30e1e1a7d2b9a9f230dd0275bd40480d
Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Depends-On: I0a847ad4077a02a02ad817dd189a6a31c3637a93
(cherry picked from commit 3f303b907ba55f526a4e15a4c7b29698c37dcf52)

subject: Do not update barbican_api pipeline when keystone auth is used
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:10:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 23:03:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-08 18:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-10-13 21:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-07 15:10:23.000000000', 'message': "Do not update barbican_api pipeline when keystone auth is used

The barbican_api pipeline is not longer used by default and the current
default pipeline, barbican-api, includes the required middleware to
use keystone auth.
This change removes the logic to tweak the barbican_api pipeline when
keystone auth is used.

One remaining knwon issue is that current barbican_api_paste_ini
doesn't support updating the root composite to replace the pipeline
used by the one without keystoneauth.
Currently usage of auth_strategy != 'keystone' just shows warning and
users should manually edit the pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1946378
Change-Id: I34fecc5265cbc9bc6d5b46b5a96f056b47b64c59
"}, {'created': '2021-10-07 15:28:11.000000000', 'message': "Do not update barbican_api pipeline when keystone auth is used

commit_message:
Do not update barbican_api pipeline when keystone auth is used

The barbican_api pipeline is not longer used by default and the current
default pipeline, barbican-api, includes the required middleware to
use keystone auth.
This change removes the logic to tweak the barbican_api pipeline when
keystone auth is used.

One remaining knwon issue is that current barbican_api_paste_ini
doesn't support updating the root composite to replace the pipeline
used by the one without keystoneauth.
Currently usage of auth_strategy != 'keystone' just shows warning and
users should manually edit the pipeline.

Closes-Bug: #1946378
Change-Id: I34fecc5265cbc9bc6d5b46b5a96f056b47b64c59

commit_message:
Remove the ceilometer::policy class

... because it was deprecated during the Xena cycle and has had no
effect since then.

Change-Id: I5c65afbc9f33b8d02545cceb29f305e8bd50ff47

commit_message:
Add support for [nova] api_micro_version

Manila provides the api_micro_version for Nova and Glance but currently
the parameter is implemented for only Glance.
This change adds the parameter to the nova class so that api version
can be defined for both of these two services.

Change-Id: I6ab2257febe68eff05c0a1ea903ab84e3292f4ee

commit_message:
Do not set [DEFAULT] network_api_class

... because the network_api_class parameter is no longer effective in
the [DEFAULT] section and it should be defined in each backend section
instead[1].

[1] 5af3b8e68b5d5351b3a53114d179a78ba1bf466f

Change-Id: I96d4b3434e3650253fcde86069e30500b27184dd

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ie22a21db8d138b6358b06a05da8a0a87ffac1eb4

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-02 20:24:43.000000000', 'message': 'Abstraction of Snapshot Metadata API

This patch abstracts the code previously submitted to apply to more
user-facing resources than just Snapshots. Database  migration was
proposed in previous patchset.

In this abstraction we apply metadata capabilities to:
Shares
Share Instances (only for replicas)
Share Instance Export Location
Share Access Rules
Snapshots
Snapshot Instance Export Location
Snapshot Access Rules
Share Groups

commit_message:
WIP:Abstraction of Snapshot Metadata API

This patch abstracts the code previously submitted to apply to more
user-facing resources than just Snapshots. Database  migration was
proposed in previous patchset.

In this abstraction we apply metadata capabilities to:
Shares
Share Instances (only for replicas)
Share Instance Export Location
Share Access Rules
Snapshots
Snapshot Instance Export Location
Snapshot Access Rules
Share Groups
Share Group Snapshots
Security Service
Share Networks
Share Network Subnets

We also identify any metadata created by the manila service as
user_modifiable=False, to prevent the end-user from changing this
information. This is especially important for the export location
resource.

Partially-implements: bp metadata-for-share-resources
Change-Id: Ic4e176e8c6fddbc8b0cfe814b3398cb5a30625d5

commit_message:
Log the exception-info when an error raises in hanlder

on the line #114 we set the liveness probe to False, which triggers
restart of the Kuryr Controller.

However without DEBUG, the LOG message is hidden behind DEBUG.

This makes it harder to troubleshoot if the Handler failed with this
exception

Change-Id: I71deb8434273ce39453d69a05d6bd8b105fe2c2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-12 20:39:05.000000000', 'message': '[ceph-mon] Prevent mon-check from removing mons when down temporarily

A race condition exists that can cause the mon-check pod to delete
mons from the monmap that are only down temporarily. This sometimes
causes issues with the monmap when those mons come back up. This
change adds a check to see if the list of mons in the monmap is
larger than expected before removing anything. If not, the monmap
is left alone.

Change-Id: I43b186bf80741fc178c6806d24c179417d7f2406

commit_message:
[ceph-mon] Prevent mon-check from removing mons when down temporarily

A race condition exists that can cause the mon-check pod to delete
mons from the monmap that are only down temporarily. This sometimes
causes issues with the monmap when those mons come back up. This
change adds a check to see if the list of mons in the monmap is
larger than expected before removing anything. If not, the monmap
is left alone.

Change-Id: I43b186bf80741fc178c6806d24c179417d7f2406

commit_message:
Fix using host_routes in VIP subnet with amphorav2

Ensure that amphorae_network_config parameter is not modified in
AmphoraPostVIPPlug. Modifying it would break amphorav2 persistence by
introducing non-serializable elements in the subnet dict

Story: 2008955
Task: 42580

Change-Id: I8f0d3ba1d083c7e37e7e26617826400a538a0890

commit_message:
Fix management network selection when calculating deltas

Providing an AZ dict without the 'management_network' field to
CalculateAmphoraDelta task broke the calculation of the interfaces to be
deleted. As a result, the management interface might have been removed
by the HandleNetworkDelta task.

Change-Id: I72796b3ed1c3f180cca8c005fdbad81d9dbef37d
(cherry picked from commit b41b275b8314f79cdafe1575d84aface2b5861c5)
(cherry picked from commit 8681637da0f99b4dda128bfd8ffd45be20de6112)
(cherry picked from commit 60b14c69dc9c6ab6aedf6928004dae0c958eafb5)
(cherry picked from commit 4703bebd418c11adc119aece0c436f5401a9138a)

subject: Update nr_open limit value in the amphora
messages: [{'account_id': 29244, 'date': '2021-09-02 13:24:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2021-09-13 07:59:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-10-13 17:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 13:24:01.000000000', 'message': 'Update nr_open limit value in the amphora

Using haproxy 2.x, the ideal rlimit value for nr_open is close to
connection_limit * 2.5 (see compute_ideal_* in src/haproxy.c).
Set this limit to 2,600,000 in the amphora to support a loadbalancer
with maxconn 1M.

This prevents the following warning messages when launching/reloading
haproxy:

* "Cannot raise FD limit to 2375058, limit is 2097152."
* "FD limit (2097152) too low for maxconn=950000/maxsock=2375058. Please
  raise 'ulimit-n' to 2375058 or more to avoid any trouble."

Change-Id: I6251cd17bd6fa9faf5109e50c2190dda3614908d
(cherry picked from commit 4174f4a5a47a208d7cb7fa6d736f5bb20e995b64)
(cherry picked from commit f55376bf5d715e5c1f0b3ace6c2190f8e9def28a)
(cherry picked from commit c177987f81171845324a71ad6b7bffe6b151379e)
'}]
commit_message:
Update nr_open limit value in the amphora

Using haproxy 2.x, the ideal rlimit value for nr_open is close to
connection_limit * 2.5 (see compute_ideal_* in src/haproxy.c).
Set this limit to 2,600,000 in the amphora to support a loadbalancer
with maxconn 1M.

This prevents the following warning messages when launching/reloading
haproxy:

* "Cannot raise FD limit to 2375058, limit is 2097152."
* "FD limit (2097152) too low for maxconn=950000/maxsock=2375058. Please
  raise 'ulimit-n' to 2375058 or more to avoid any trouble."

Change-Id: I6251cd17bd6fa9faf5109e50c2190dda3614908d
(cherry picked from commit 4174f4a5a47a208d7cb7fa6d736f5bb20e995b64)
(cherry picked from commit f55376bf5d715e5c1f0b3ace6c2190f8e9def28a)
(cherry picked from commit c177987f81171845324a71ad6b7bffe6b151379e)

commit_message:
Fix PlugVIPAmphora revert function in amphorav2

This function should call the unplug_aap_port function that takes
DB models as arguments, but the subnet is not converted and is passed as
a provider dict. It triggers a "'dict' object has no attribute
'network_id'" error when reverting a load balancer creation.
Ensure that the subnet is converted from dict to DB model.

Story 2009157
Task 43132

Change-Id: I4bec17a484d0d39c9cca389421c63d378c36353c
(cherry picked from commit b88154f086e5261d4a888598cce34e72ec1545b9)
(cherry picked from commit c524eaf13e39ba84e1b6cb57579326f5925193ab)
(cherry picked from commit bf012c2cda775d52abbd829f50fcdad07b29be5a)

even though we don't follow the normal release cycle process, we may want to keep the function but mark it deprecated, regardless I think this is a good idea."}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-23 02:45:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> even though we don't follow the normal release cycle process, we may want to keep the function but mark it deprecated, regardless I think this is a good idea.

Yeah, we can do that. I just went with this route since making it work with Ephemeral Heat was such a dramatic change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/805575

ie, that change for Ephemeral Heat no longer extends the DeployOvercloud class. So we're not taking any -e, --templates, arguments. It's literally just running the deploy_steps_playbook.yaml and not doing anything with Heat now. 

But if everyone agree's, we can deprecate it and leave it executing the deploy_steps_playbook.yaml until we eventually remove it."}, {'account_id': 30073, 'date': '2021-09-26 23:08:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:

> > Patch Set 3:

> 
> Yeah, we can do that. I just went with this route since making it work with Ephemeral Heat was such a dramatic change:
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/805575
> 
> ie, that change for Ephemeral Heat no longer extends the DeployOvercloud class. So we're not taking any -e, --templates, arguments. It's literally just running the deploy_steps_playbook.yaml and not doing anything with Heat now. 
> 
> But if everyone agree's, we can deprecate it and leave it executing the deploy_steps_playbook.yaml until we eventually remove it.

My bad, the final iteration I did end up extending the DeployOvercloud class again. I just don't do anything with any of the parsed args. Update converge is largely unnecessary now with
ephemeral Heat. There is no Heat stack to update,
so we are doing nothing more than executing a
standard deployment using Ansible. Removing
the requirement for update converge will simplify
the process and improve user experience by reducing
the time it takes to perform minor updates.

commit_message:
Remove update converge

Update converge is largely unnecessary now with
ephemeral Heat. There is no Heat stack to update,
so we are doing nothing more than executing a
standard deployment using Ansible. Removing
the requirement for update converge will simplify
the process and improve user experience by reducing
the time it takes to perform minor updates.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-upgrade/+/810134
Change-Id: I750a733b722353d1ea0c6f904bafc769d7ddb9ff

commit_message:
Bump metadata for release

With xena ending, we're cutting tags that can be used for xena if
someone actually wants to do that.

Change-Id: I261bf20c7eb33bb32d0d229a27a6f9df9b8f61cd

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Fix for legacy PowerMax OS around generations

In the previous version of PowerMax OS generations of snapVx were
used instead of unique snap ids which were just introduced.
A generation can be returned as a 0 integer which equates to False
in python.  The fix is to convert the int to a string if it is
returned from REST as an int.

Closes-Bug: #1938572
Change-Id: I5b660776190f3026296d6d3237bd3b0d609f769f

The error message presented for unsupported storage-assisted
retypes incorrectly states host-assisted retype is not
supported. Changing message and adding some additional
relevant information.

Change-Id: I12d05d2ec670e8db037060b29e59eeb7cdd30ebc
'}, {'created': '2021-09-15 17:32:25.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax Driver - Update unsupported retype combinations

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Update unsupported retype combinations

1. Allowing for metro to metro as the volume is simply being moved within
the masking view.
2. Updating the message, as target metro is not possible when source is
not metro and host assisted migration does not support replicated
volumes.

Change-Id: I12d05d2ec670e8db037060b29e59eeb7cdd30ebc

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-12 14:58:33.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Enable fernet token cache by default"

This reverts commit b6ae699567b09eb0c2789883e0823839e1cedc81.

commit_message:
Revert "Enable fernet token cache by default"

This reverts commit b6ae699567b09eb0c2789883e0823839e1cedc81.

Reason for revert: token_caching is enabled by default. We don't need to define the parameter to enable it. Also, the setting is now named keystone::cache::token_caching

Change-Id: Ied7e31438ef07e6d6e8c8fd81b25c9a8e812b6d8

commit_message:
Pause fedora-34 to debug network problems

We seem to have network setup issues with fedora-34s latest images.
Pause the image so that we can delete the most recent build then figure
it out from there without nodepool replacing things with broken images
again.

Change-Id: I73cab4c0c581e70fdb3b972c0fdc1f8eed637583

Otherwise, if you deploy this file in an environment glance will throw

use double quotes so it's not an issue.

Otherwise, if you deploy this file in an environment glance will throw
500s with the following error:

  expected <block end>, but found '<scalar>'
  in "<unicode string>", line 22, column 110:

Change-Id: I9315a1039246f3db10c3902583eb6ca51cffdba4
'}]
commit_message:
Use double quotes for string comparisons policies in glance

TripleO lays down policy check strings wrapped in single quotes, which
will break if we don't escape them. This commit updates the policies to
use double quotes so it's not an issue.

Otherwise, if you deploy this file in an environment glance will throw
500s with the following error:

  expected <block end>, but found '<scalar>'
  in "<unicode string>", line 22, column 110:
     ... or project_id:%(member_id)s or 'community':%(visibility)s or 'pu ...

Change-Id: I9315a1039246f3db10c3902583eb6ca51cffdba4

commit_message:
Drop non-bundle manila from puppet-config

Drop "include tripleo::profile::pacemaker::manila" and replace it with
"include tripleo::profile::pacemaker::manila::share_bundle" so we can
eventually drop the non-bundle implementation of manila-share.

Both puppet manifests end up including the base manila profile anyways.

Change-Id: I7ae78f506f0b0c8020edde6f679ace13a71e604a

In ansible, usage of true/false for boolean values, instead of yes/no,
is considered as a best practise and is enforced by ansible-lint with
the "truthy value should be one of false, true (truthy)" rule.

commit_message:
Use true/false for boolean values

In ansible, usage of true/false for boolean values, instead of yes/no,
is considered as a best practise and is enforced by ansible-lint with
the "truthy value should be one of false, true (truthy)" rule.

This change replaces usage of yes/no by true/false to follow that
practise.

Change-Id: I3313278f1ef6cbee0f906aca0a77bde1a3c53784

commit_message:
Introduce ApplyCephConfigOverridesOnUpdate

Add ApplyCephConfigOverridesOnUpdate boolean which defaults
to false. If this parameter is true, CephConfigOverrides are
applied to the Ceph cluster not only during the initial
deployment but also during each update.

Related-Bug: #1946253
Depends-On: Iac75ab454b3a5983f3a700f2e47d73706ec5b834
Change-Id: I798cfc13df8f199326e2ea9275cf605e7cf961af

As part of the move to helm v3, all the charts in the OSH repos
will no longer lint/build properly due to a lack of helm serve
in helm v3.

This change modifies the helm-toolkit repo location to the
osh-infra repo in order to account for the removal oh helm serve.

in future changes.

Change-Id: I90d25943d69ad6c76455f7778a4894f00c525c46
'}]
commit_message:
Update htk requirements repo

As part of the move to helm v3, all the charts in the OSH repos
will no longer lint/build properly due to a lack of helm serve
in helm v3.

This change modifies the helm-toolkit repo location to the
osh-infra repo in order to account for the removal oh helm serve.

This work is part of the migration to helm v3 and will be utilized
in future changes.

Change-Id: I90d25943d69ad6c76455f7778a4894f00c525c46

set root_disk to /dev/{{ libvirt_diskdev }} for all the overcloud nodes

The purpose of this patch is to ensure that the ceph nodes got the proper root disk
{{ libvirt_diskdev }} is dfined on
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/roles/libvirt/defaults/main.yml#L30

Change-Id: I364b5bd2b5f2fa016485c05d221e8d5bb52676af
Closes-bug: #1943851

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-16 16:49:57.000000000', 'message': 'Native multibackend-matrix Zuul v3 job

Port the legacy legacy-tempest-dsvm-multibackend-matrix job to the
native Zuul v3 syntax, and rename it following the guidelines
(cinder-multibackend-matrix-migration).

This job tests the migration between two different backends
specified through the volume.backend_names configuration
key in tempest.conf.

Now the job leverages the existing zuul code, namely the
run-tempest role, which is called multiple times with all
the possible combinations of the 3 tested backends
(lvm, ceph, nfs) where the source and the destination differ.

The final JUnitXML output summarizes the test results
for each of the tested combinations.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
-> due to the addition and removal of several jobs in the newest
.zuul.yaml

Change-Id: I34e7e48ee63c4c269f82ae178a7118ed402cad6d
(cherry picked from commit 1c0c25babb3d9b13e271e37458cd55b974085901)
'}]
commit_message:
Native multibackend-matrix Zuul v3 job

Port the legacy legacy-tempest-dsvm-multibackend-matrix job to the
native Zuul v3 syntax, and rename it following the guidelines
(cinder-multibackend-matrix-migration).

This job tests the migration between two different backends
specified through the volume.backend_names configuration
key in tempest.conf.

Now the job leverages the existing zuul code, namely the
run-tempest role, which is called multiple times with all
the possible combinations of the 3 tested backends
(lvm, ceph, nfs) where the source and the destination differ.

The final JUnitXML output summarizes the test results
for each of the tested combinations.

Conflicts:
	.zuul.yaml
-> due to the addition and removal of several jobs in the newest
.zuul.yaml

Change-Id: I34e7e48ee63c4c269f82ae178a7118ed402cad6d
(cherry picked from commit 1c0c25babb3d9b13e271e37458cd55b974085901)

[{'created': '2021-10-07 07:20:07.000000000', 'message': "Get rid of jsonschema.compat usage

jsonschema.compat module is not a public interface anymore and
it got removed in version > 3.2.0
The compat module was a helper for py2/3 compatibility [1].

commit_message:
Get rid of jsonschema.compat usage

jsonschema.compat module is not a public interface anymore and
it got removed in version > 3.2.0
The compat module was a helper for py2/3 compatibility [1].
As Tempest is full py3 now, we can rework the whole
if-condition and let the timeutils to handle any wrong format.

[1] https://github.com/Julian/jsonschema/blob/v3.2.0/jsonschema/compat.py

Closes-Bug: #1946321
Change-Id: Ia78c19c06cfb712b1b8d0aff457fd2f91144dc07

commit_message:
Update EM transition date of Victoria and Xena

This patch propose to move the Extended Maintenance transition date of
stable/victoria with one week to have a less busy period of almost ~1
month after the release of Yoga to prepare.

Also updates the EM transition date of Xena to 18 months after the
initial release. This will most probably change in the future, but
let's have a more valid date there then the current one.

Change-Id: I7fec394cd914967e54b1a4651c2d2ed0ba9def37

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-15 00:16:39.000000000', 'message': 'Re-propose Unified Limits in Nova

Includes changes to reflect the current proposed implementation and
recent change in direction to use Keystone unified limits for all
limits.

commit_message:
Re-propose Unified Limits in Nova

Includes changes to reflect the current proposed implementation and
recent change in direction to use Keystone unified limits for all
limits.

Previously-approved: Ussuri, Victoria, Xena

blueprint unified-limits-nova

Change-Id: I0a572d202ebd7d4b7d7a723b316b563155b7ff37

commit_message:
Update gates

* Use bionic for ussuri build as it's the latest supported
release [0][1].
* Switch to centos 8 to run master [1][2].
* Switch default base image to ubuntu:focal.

[0] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/ussuri.html
[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I9a70aebd9636e170c6e04398356933668a2bfbba
Signed-off-by: Andrii Ostapenko <andrii.ostapenko@att.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-13 03:29:43.000000000', 'message': 'Handle urlencoded lists when filtering servers by tags

Currently the API code for parsing 'tags' filter value assumes a format
of comma-delimited string with no spaces, example:

  "tag1,tag2,tag3"

but python-openstackclient and python-novaclient both pass the filter
value as a urlencoded list, example:

  "['tag1', 'tag2', 'tag3']"

This results in a failure to match any tags when python-openstackclient
or python-novaclient are used to list servers filtered by tags because
the tags are not parsed out from the query parameter value.

This adds handling of the urlencoded list string format to the API and
retains the handling of comma-delimited strings so that existing
clients relying on it continue to work.

Closes-Bug: #1946816

Change-Id: I37c49e48f3c54685c21f07f691039c0495bedf5a
'}]
commit_message:
Handle urlencoded lists when filtering servers by tags

Currently the API code for parsing 'tags' filter value assumes a format
of comma-delimited string with no spaces, example:

  "tag1,tag2,tag3"

but python-openstackclient and python-novaclient both pass the filter
value as a urlencoded list, example:

  "['tag1', 'tag2', 'tag3']"

This results in a failure to match any tags when python-openstackclient
or python-novaclient are used to list servers filtered by tags because
the tags are not parsed out from the query parameter value.

This adds handling of the urlencoded list string format to the API and
retains the handling of comma-delimited strings so that existing
clients relying on it continue to work.

Closes-Bug: #1946816

Change-Id: I37c49e48f3c54685c21f07f691039c0495bedf5a

commit_message:
Update lint job to use helm v3

This change updates the lint job to use helm v3. This
is part of the effort to migrate from helm v2 to v3 and
to ensure each chart is compatible with helm v3.

Change-Id: Ibc8ba5d8fe8efc3637d64df61305602385e644e4

commit_message:
feat: Add irrelevant-files for zuul jobs

Add irrelevant-files for zuul jobs so that we can reduce the
job cost time when the patch is just docs changes or not-related
changes for these jobs.

Change-Id: I6323a3458927ca265136c8be91fda1c7138074d1

commit_message:
Improve osh-infra-deploy helm v3 job

This change improves the osh-infra-deploy job to
successfully deploy minikube with helm v3 along with
the necessary namespaces. Future changes will modify
the install scripts for each job to make them helm
v3 compatible.

Change-Id: I08a94046f86f7c92be7580fbf10751150d2fcecc

commit_message:
Add support for Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay

This change updates documentation, examples and tests to support
Ironic inspection through DHCP-relay. The dnsmasq service should be
configured with more specific format set in the variable
``ironic_dnsmasq_dhcp_range``. See the dnsmasq manual page [1].

[1] https://thekelleys.org.uk/dnsmasq/docs/dnsmasq-man.html

Change-Id: I9488a72db588e31289907668f1997596a8ccdec6
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Limit metrics_socket_file permissions

This limits the metrics_socket_file permissions to 0o660. Prior
to this change, symbolic constants were used, resulting in
0o707 permissions.

Closes-Bug: #1945533
Change-Id: I009ffbc10d3400881c6f8b2178494ba180d6549f

subject: Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects
messages:
[{'account_id': 30314, 'date': '2021-07-14 10:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2021-08-06 16:52:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-08-10 12:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Hello,

Thanks for these changes.
Few related tests and a release note would be welcome.

Do you mind to add them?
Else they could be added through a follow up patch.'}, {'account_id': 30314, 'date': '2021-09-01 12:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 30314, 'date': '2021-09-01 12:51:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Do you mind to add them?
> Else they could be added through a follow up patch.
I've added a note to the releasenotes. Hope the style is okay. If not, I'm open for suggestions. :)

Regarding a test: I tried creating one, but it is really hard to get an object that breaks this in python. I think this needs to be an externally implemented object (something written as an extension) or an internal object. What did not work: overriding __getattr__ overriding __class__ as a property, adding and using a method with an lru_cache. I still see this breaking consistently in our OpenStack prod environment, though I don't know where functools._lru_list_elem comes from (using python 3.6.9).

Do you have any suggestions how I could test this?"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-10-05 08:30:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Added a linked bug. This LGTM otherwise.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-10-13 13:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-14 10:53:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects

The backdoor command fo() uses isinstance() to check if an object is an
instance of a class. This only works with objects that have a __class__
attribute, else an AttributeError is raised by isinstance(). This is
seldomly the case, though if there is one such object fo() will cease to
work. Therefore we need to protect us against this case by checking for
a __class__ attribute before calling isinstance().

An example for an object without __class__ would be
functools._lru_list_elem.

Change-Id: Ia4c5cbdc249535d36f6e71f7b2a7359bc6fdf219
'}, {'created': '2021-09-01 12:40:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects

work. Therefore we need to protect us against this case by checking for
a __class__ attribute before calling isinstance().

An example for an object without __class__ would be

Change-Id: Ia4c5cbdc249535d36f6e71f7b2a7359bc6fdf219
'}, {'created': '2021-10-05 08:29:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects

The backdoor command fo() uses isinstance() to check if an object is an
instance of a class. This only works with objects that have a __class__
attribute, else an AttributeError is raised by isinstance(). This is
seldomly the case, though if there is one such object fo() will cease to
work. Therefore we need to protect us against this case by checking for
a __class__ attribute before calling isinstance().

An example for an object without __class__ would be

Change-Id: Ia4c5cbdc249535d36f6e71f7b2a7359bc6fdf219
Closes-Bug: #1946072
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fo() backdoor command for non-class objects

The backdoor command fo() uses isinstance() to check if an object is an
instance of a class. This only works with objects that have a __class__
attribute, else an AttributeError is raised by isinstance(). This is
seldomly the case, though if there is one such object fo() will cease to
work. Therefore we need to protect us against this case by checking for
a __class__ attribute before calling isinstance().

An example for an object without __class__ would be
functools._lru_list_elem.

Change-Id: Ia4c5cbdc249535d36f6e71f7b2a7359bc6fdf219
Closes-Bug: #1946072
